1.text: Remove the labels from a plastic 2 L (0.53 US gal) soda bottle.

2.text: Draw a line with a marker around the neck of the plastic bottle.

3.text: Cut the neck off the plastic bottle along the marked line.

4.text: Using a paper towel, grease the inside of the bottle and funnel with olive oil.

5.text: Flip the neck upside-down, and place the neck into the bottle.

6.text: Tape the two pieces together along the cut edges.

7.text: Make two holes on opposite sides of the funnel's edge.

8.text: Tie the ends of a 12 in (30 cm) long string to each punched hole.

9.text: Use grease or meat scraps as bait during spring and early summer.

10.text: Bait the trap with something sweet during late summer and early fall.

11.text: Pour the mixed bait solution into the funnel of the wasp trap.

12.text: Set up your trap outside on the ground or hang it up.

14.text: Undo the tape on the trap, and clean it out every 3 days.

15.text: Bury or flush the dead wasps to avoid attracting others.

16.text: Tape the wasp trap together again, and refill it with your bait solution.
